description:
After the Second World War, Greece became one of the first battlefields between the two super powers – the United States and the Soviet Union – who were wrestling for ideological domination. In 1947, the Truman Doctrine provided American aid to Greece to help contain communism. Greece was in the midst of a civil war between communist fighters and the Government army supported by a coalition of right-wing and centrist forces. Greek Tragedy recreates this conflict in a team card driven format.

—description from the designer

Enter a horse race, get your "tickets" and let the game begin.
The game is focused on betting on horses, but during the race you can end up betting more, at the end of the race, the accumulated amount will be divided among the people who have 1 of the 4 "tickets" of the winner horse.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

The players roll the special die to determine the color of their starting and destination spaces. The players then take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the players have to answer questions about traffic rules and other safety issues.

Beside the colors to determine the starting and destination spaces, the die has the following faces:

     go 1 space forward (yellow)
     go 2 spaces forward (blue)
     go 1 space backward (red)
     go 5 spaces forward (green)
     miss a turn (yellow)
     roll again (red)


The first player to reach his destination space wins the game.

The game was published in the October 1971 issue of the GDR magazine "Die ABC-Zeitung".

—user summary

Uwaga, spoiler! ("Watch out, spoiler!") is the party game for real cinephiles. Check, if you can describe well-known films or tv series without spoilers. And you have only 60 seconds for that! Time, start!

How to describe a movie without spoilers?
That's what "Uwaga, spoiler!" game is about. Draw a card, choose one of two titles, tell about it to your team, without using forbidden words. Who'll be the best reviewer?

And now something for real geeks, pro mode!
Try to describe a title without naming actors, character's names! No time for boredom, try new game modes!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Uwaga, Spoiler! to gra towarzyska dla prawdziwych kinomaniaków. SprawdÅº, czy potrafisz opisaÄ‡ znane tytuÅ‚y bez uÅ¼ywania spoilerów. Masz na to tylko 60 sekund! Czas, start!

Jak opowiadaÄ‡ o filmach i serialach tak, by nie zdradziÄ‡ zbyt wiele?

Na tym wÅ‚aÅ›nie polega wyzwanie gry Uwaga, Spoiler! Wylosuj kartÄ™ z tytuÅ‚em i przedstaw go swojej druÅ¼ynie, nie uÅ¼ywajÄ…c zakazanych sÅ‚ów! Kto okaÅ¼e siÄ™ najlepszym recenzentem?

A teraz coÅ› dla prawdziwych geeków!

Spróbujcie przedstawiÄ‡ tytuÅ‚ bez wymieniania imion aktorów i bohaterów oraz nazw wÅ‚asnych. MoÅ¼ecie wymyÅ›laÄ‡ nowe zasady gry. Tu nie ma mowy o nudzie!

W grze Uwaga, Spoiler! Waszym zadaniem jest umiejÄ™tne naprowadzenie druÅ¼yny na wskazany na karcie film lub serial. Do kaÅ¼dego tytuÅ‚u dodana jest lista spoilerów, których uÅ¼ycie oznacza utratÄ™ punktów, wiÄ™c uwaÅ¼aj na to, co mówisz! Musisz wykazaÄ‡ siÄ™ kreatywnoÅ›ciÄ… i umiejÄ™tnie przybliÅ¼yÄ‡ treÅ›Ä‡ danego tytuÅ‚u, tak aby Twoja druÅ¼yna zdobyÅ‚a jak najwiÄ™cej punktów. Macie na to zaledwie 60 sekund. Tylko bez spoilerów, proszÄ™!

—description from the publisher

Dan Dare Mountains of Mars Expedition is a simple roll and move race game based on the British Science fiction Comic hero from the 1950's.

The playing board is 3 dimensional square based pyramid, made from 4 Triangular sections. Players each have a small coloured peg like playing piece that is inserted into holes in the playing board. Players move by the roll of a dice. The holes create a path up each mountain side, from the mountain base to its apex.

First player to ascend the mountain and reach the top is the winner.

—user summary

Influencer! #fame #shame #game is an action-packed board game, 100% analog, with simple rules and retro charm. The satirical look at the business of influencers, pumped full of clichés like the lips of some social media beauty queens, ensures gaming fun and moments of foreign shame.

You'll roam the city hunting for the most lucrative posts. Get in shape at the gym, chill in the park, or get your wrinkles removed at the beauty doctor. Show it all to your fans, because oddly enough, hundreds of thousands are always interested! A visit to the café will give you new power, and hip mega-hypes offer you chances to get lots of new followers - but do you have time for that? Always choose the best challenges and plan your route. Quickly give your competitors a shitstorm, make an illegal YOLO-posting (...if no one sends the police after you!), and then rush off to the disco for the coolest party-posting ever! Crap, now you have to dodge the groupies blocking your way...

Will you be the first to get 1 million followers?

—description from the publisher

From the box: "Why should children have all the fun? This Brainbox will help improve observation, memory and conversation skills and is a fabulous trip down memory lane."

This is a Game of the Brainbox series, focused on senior people (in fact, the game displays age as 55+)

It contains 55 Cards, 1 rules card, 1 sand timer and a die.

This 8-card Top Trumps set plays the same as the original game but with only two players. It comes with the following cards:


     How to Play a 2-player mini game of Top Trumps using six cards



     Indiana Jones
     Colonel Dovchenko
     Irina Spalko
     Marion Ravenwood (1957)
     Mutt Williams
     Ugha Warrior



     Card advertising 4 Top Trumps: Star Wars titles and a "Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" movie magazine.


—user summary

The Original Skateboarding Card Game was conceived in Afghanistan when a passionate Skater, on a mission and away from home, had the strong desire to feel the emotion of Skateboarding. Although riding his board was not an option, the tricks did not stop flowing in his mind, every time a bunker or T-Wall was spotted, a trick was inevitably created in his imagination. This game is the result of breaking down the creative process of skateboarding, allowing players to experience the excitement that skaters feel when formulating their tricks in the real life. It doesn't matter if you can jump or not. This is our language, our way of expressing the Art of Skateboarding action in our own words.

You are in command of the Scottish armies in their bid for independence from the English Monarchy.

Lead your people to freedom as they cheer your name “Braveheart!”

The English outnumber your army in both battles, so your decisions require some outstanding leadership. If you expect to win the day, the decisions are yours…

Braveheart Solitaire, you take the role of William Wallace or Robert the Bruce against an opposing English army. There are two unique battles, Falkirk and Bannockburn. Within the two battles, you have six opportunities to defeat a challenging English Bot plus six chances to beat a difficult English Bot. The two grand battles provide a player with a total of twenty-four plays to claim victory.

All you need to provide is a die, a pen, and a sense of adventure to play.

A typical 1950's electic matching quiz game.  Comes with 6 cards printed on both sides, each containing 12 illustrations and 12 descriptions. There are 5 additional Kiddie Quiz cards included in this set.

Players select a quiz board to use and answer trivia questions. Right answers are indicated by the quiz board lights.

To play, hold one selector tip in your left hand and place it on a contact station, or question. With the card above, we will select ‘Life Boat’ in the upper left corner. Then, holding the other selector tip in your right hand, place it on another contact station, or answer.

In this case, it would be the metal disk just below ‘Anchor’ on the upper side of the Nautilus, between the Vertical Fin and the Rudder & Propeller. When you have made this final contact, the circuit is completed and the red light will glow to indicate a correct answer. If you were to place the selector tip in your right hand on the wrong metal disc, say in the lower left corner by the Anchor, nothing would happen, and you would have given a wrong answer. Play would then pass to the next player.

Welcome, city planners! Design the best city block using patterns from the new and exciting "Cube Shaker". You'll place a mix of tiles to help grow the thriving city. The best design wins the game!

Shake That City is a family puzzly tile-laying game for 1-4 players, that plays under an hour! The game is played over a series of rounds. The active player shakes the Cube Shaker and presses its slider to reveal a 3x3 pattern, based on which they need to place the corresponding building tiles of a single color of their choice on their board. The building tiles correspond to roads, factories, shops, parks and of course, homes. The other players then pick any building color other than the one the active player picked, then place matching colored tiles in the matching pattern on their board. Players earn points for tile-placement combinations and for the completed bonus point tiles around the edge of their board.

• Roads wants to connect to an edge of the board.
• Factories wants to be next to other factories and roads.
• Homes want to be placed in clusters that are as small as possible — the smallest being a single tile — so long as they're not next to a factory.
• Parks wants to be next to homes and factories.
• Shops score increasingly more the closer they are placed to the city center, but if they're not placed on an edge, they need to be adjacent to a road connected to the board's edge in order to score. Without road access, you'll have no products to sell!

At game's end, players earn points for tile-placement combinations and for the completed bonus point tiles around the edge of their board.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 51 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose game coins.

—user summary

In a dehumanised future, where every trace of culture dies one at a time, a powerful corporation sends its time thieves to the past with the mission to reshape crucial historical events according to their own vision. Their goal being to erase the very idea of revolution.

Professor Constant and his team created their own time machine to stop that corporation. But no one heard from them since their last mission which took place during the French Revolution.

In 2222, you and your group find refuge in what happens to be the Professor's lab…

The game includes 2 chapters lasting about 120 minutes each.
It features 60+ minutes of original audio fiction, 30+ puzzles, 24 historical facts to uncover and listen to.
Play with your mobile device or with the online web interface. No rules to read, the game begins as soon as you open the box.

—description from the publisher (translated)

The players represent either an automobile (black track), a bicyclist (red track) or a pedestrian (blue track) ant take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Rules for giant space ship or naval battles with lots of customization. Each round the ships can move, cruise, ram and shoot depending on what type of ship it is. The different ship types is scouts, fighters, destroyers and battleships. The game ends after four rounds and the player that controls most objective markers wins.

Tributo de Sangre (Tribute of Blood) is an operational game for two players, framed in the colonial conflict that confronted the Spanish Army with the hardened local tribes of the Rif (North of the Moroccan Sultanate) which was administered by Spain as a Protectorate. The game focuses on the peak phase of the conflict, led by the Campaign before and after the so-called "Annual Disaster" (1921), which caused the death in combat of thousands of Spanish soldiers. A tragic episode that would decisively mark the political and military future of Spain during the two incoming decades.

Tribute of Blood is a card driven game, with a map of areas that replicates the domains of the Riffian tribes, and a network of connected spaces that allow a “point to point” movement through a rugged territory, suitable for ambushes and surprise raids The basic mechanics consist of the use of action points to deploy movement, logistics, offensive and diplomatic operations. The events of the cards will serve as drivers of these actions, while providing the necessary "historical flavor". During each game turn, players will be able to launch raids, incursions, charges, sieges, assaults..., as well as pressure their opponent with various diplomatic actions.

In Tribute of Blood, one player represents the Spanish Army and another the Riffian rebels. The game can be summarized in a pendulum movement, with both sides adopting offensive and defensive postures during different phases of the Campaign: the Rif side enjoys the initiative during the first turns and has the chance to cause a disaster similar to the historical one in Spanish lines. Starting on turns 6 and 7, the Spanish reinforcements will even the scales and provide the opportunity to regain control of the territory and avenge their deaths. The game is asymmetrical in many of its mechanics, beginning with the different positional "habitat" of each of the contenders: the Spanish formations move from point to point, through connection lines, while the Riffian rebels (harcas) unfold and move inside and through the areas (Cabilas). This means that there is not a defined combat front, and the Spanish must launch constant incursions to confront Abd-el Krim's warriors. It is a simulation of an irregular and asymmetric warfare, with interesting innovations on mechanics and interactions.

Tribute of Blood consists of the following scenarios, each with an increasing level of depth and complexity:

- 1. Historical Scenario: "Annual's Disaster" (5 turns)
- 2. Alternative Scenario: "Avoiding Disaster" (5 turns)
- 3. Advanced Scenario: “Recapture of the Kert” (11 turns)
- 4. Annual Campaign; 1921: (16 turns)

Sector 18 is a 1-2 player, Sci-Fiction themed, tactical space warfare card-game.

Rival factions are fighting over the territory in this sector, which holds precious resources. You must conquer planets, build ships, upgrade your base and ships, defend against enemy advances and ultimately destroy the enemy’s base to claim this sector for their own!

Features multiple asymmetrical factions, each with varying abilities and tactical strengths. During gameplay, players will take turns performing an action from the list of available actions on their base and shield cards. New actions are unlocked as the player spends Resources to upgrade their base and shield cards.

You win by reducing your enemies base to 0 health.
You lose by letting your base fall to 0 health.

—description from the designer

Ahoy privateer! A hurricane the likes of which ye’ve never seen is bearing down on Doubloon Lagoon, the site of the lost wreck of the treasure-teeming megaship, The Dorado. Rumors have it that the storm is shaking the booty free of the clutches of the reefs, and rife for the taking. However, ye not be the only pirates in these parts, and the hurricane winds are filling sails, me hearty. So get all hands on deck and beat those bilge rats to the treasure, or send them to the briney deep.

This is a grid-based, pirate-themed, battle royale sailing game that uses mechanics such as wind direction, dice battling, and movement economy to race and battle your friends to be the last ship afloat with the most treasure aboard when the storm hits. You command 3 ships; a slow and heavily armored/gunned Galleon, a balanced Brigantine, and a weak yet fast Sloop. Each of these ships have different attributes in regards to bonuses they receive in movement, cannon power, and defenses.

Rather than chess-style movement, each turn the wind will (or may not) change direction, effecting all of the ships ability to sail on certain headings. Learn the actual points of sail used by sailers to maximize your movement and chart the best course to play the wind and best your opponents.

Each turn, a randomly generated chest of treasure will surface somewhere in the play area, creating an ever shifting goal for you while you fend off other players and dodge cannon fire. Win the game by being the last one afloat with most treasure when the turn-based timer runs out and the hurricane hits. Randomly generated wind, treasure locations, unnavigable-island tiles, and up to 8 players make for different play styles and outcomes with every session.

This polyomino tile-laying, push your luck game is a two dimensional retelling of the classic grocery store dilemma- "Should I carry more bags with fewer items inside, or can I just pile it all in one bag and carry it all at once?"

Each player will start with a gridded card of their standard grocery bag, with a communal field of polyomino foods between them, separated into departments by color. On their turn, they will roll a die dictating which department they must draw from and place within the confines of their bag. You may exceed out of the "top" of your bag, but when you do so you risk dropping items or worse, the dreaded "bag rip."

At their discretion, players may draw another bag card from a pile (aka bags just in your car) to create more space to carry more items into the house. These bags have different dimensions - such as a convenience store bag, wine shop bag, clothing store bags, recycled totes, and more.

Scoring is resolved at the end of the game by totaling the scores indicated on each of the food items that you successfully brought to the house, dividing by the number of bags you used, and subtracting the scores of any of the food items that were dropped or suffered a bag rip.

Valls 1809 is a Napoleonic wargame from the Spanish War of Independence. A battle in which Saint Cyr, commanding the French army, wants to finish off the Spanish army under Reding before sunset. Time is key for the French side while the ally must defend itself until night falls.

A simple block wargame for two players with a solitaire option.

With 5 minutes of explanation, it allows a dynamic game with several decisions that can be key to victory in approximately 15 - 20 minutes. It can be played with the basic module, but by adding the tactical cards, they give greater historical flavor and variety in the decisions of the players. Playing with events (optional) allow replayability in different hypothetical scenarios.

Will the Spanish army hold out until nightfall or will the potential of the French army be unrivaled?

Points are scored by answering quiz questions correctly. To win the trophy you need to be in the team with more points at the end of the game.
Each team should take a pencil, a chance chip and a joker chip.
There are 200 Quiz question cards (1000 questions in total) divided in ten categories.
For a quick game select 10 question cards, one for category.
For a full-length fame select 20 question cards, two for category.
The Question Master reads questions and each team write their answers on their answer sheets.
Additionally once per game, per team a joker chip or a chance chip can be played (not in the same round).
With joker chip: each correct answer of that team in this round counts double, but each wrong answer counts a -1 point.
Chance chip: When a question is read, a team can pass for it and get one point without answering, by spending the chance chip instead.
The team with more points at the end wins.

Lights, Camera, Murder! is a Narrative mystery game inspired by Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. The game exists in a boxed version and as a book.

Set in 1940s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case centers around the murder of movie-star Clara Rose and her estranged husband Joe Fletcher. They were found shot to death on the dusty backlot of Orpheum Pictures. Classic murder-suicide? Hollywood rivalries that became too real? Mob debts unpaid? Or perhaps something far more sinister... As the Global Detective Agency’s newest recruit, it is up to you to find the truth.

The players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 they start at the Kindergarten, School, Shopping Mall or House Nr. 12 and have to reach the location in the opposite corner of the game map, while minding the traffic rules.

The players have to stop on the red and yellow spaces. To move from a yellow space the player needs to roll an even number, to move from a red space a 6 is needed.

If the player wants to use the tram, he has to wait on the blue spaces till he rolls an odd number. Additionally he loses 3 turns while riding the tram. On the fourth turn he arrives at his destination stop and continues on foot.

The first player to reach his destination location wins the game.

The game was published as a cardboard assembly kit.

Each player chooses one of four planets for his base. They get a spaceship and 7 conquest marker. The players take turns spinning the spinner and moving the spaceships accordingly. On unoccupied planets conquest markers are placed.

On planets marked with a red number, the players have to draw an action card and follow the instructions printed thereon.

If the spinner shows a robot, the player may place a robot on an unconquered planet, which now is reserved for later conquest.

If the spinner shows a monster, the player may conquer an already conquered planet for himself.

The game ends when all planets are conquered or an agreed on time limit has passed. The players add the numbers on their conquered planets and the player with the highest result wins the game.

The game was published in the comic magazines "Zack" Nr. 21 and 22 (1980).

Greedy miner dwarves are in a diamond mine, each with a dynamite and some matchsticks. Any one of them tries to collect more gems and in this way, they do anything; even stealing gems from others. Time is passing and the fuses are getting shorter and shorter. Whose dynamite will explode? Whose gems will survive? Who is the winner of this greedy game?

The game is played over several turns. Each player in their turn, roll all 6 dice. Then must choose to keep or re-roll some or all of them up to two times. Then they must resolve the dice results. Depending on what are the results, the player may: turn on the fuse of other players’ dynamite; turn his/her dynamite off; pick some gem tokens from the bag; steal some gem tokens from other players; and save some of his/her gems.

Any "Sand glass" die rolled, cannot be re-rolled. For each sand glass die rolled, one “sand” marker is moved from the upper bulb to the lower one to resemble the passage of time. Whenever the upper bulb runs out of sand, one of the central pieces of each dynamite which has burning fuse is removed.

When only one player (or no player) has unexploded dynamite left, the game ends. Then all players flip over their gem tokens and the player with the most gems is the winner.

ã‚¬ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ‡æˆ¦è¨˜Zero (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

The battle for new resources discovered on Jupiter's moon Ganymede was fierce: in 208X the battle using humanoid weapons called Mechs began in earnest, and Mechs with various equipment appeared on the scene.

The game is a card game in which players use transparent cards to equip three Mechs and fight battles with the equipped Mechs; each Mech can be equipped with three different types of equipment: right hand, left hand and back.

Who will be the first to defeat the opposing unit?
user summary

The publisher says:
In the year 208X, over the resources discovered on Jupiter, a war broke out between the Nyekundu force and the Vert force.
On the satellite Ganymede, the foothold for mining the resources on Jupiter, humanoid battle weapons called Mechs were engaged in battles.

In this game, players, each as the captain of a platoon, aim to destroy the enemy force.
The player who destroys all three Mechs of their opponent wins.

Rock Paper Heroes: Enter the Danger Room is a fast and frantic reimagining of the classic game of throwing hand gestures. Now, these gestures represent the powerful mutant abilities of eight iconic heroes who are training to become protectors of mutantkind!

Whether you want to use a mastery of the weather like Storm, cosmic-fire like Phoenix, or you're simply the best at what you do like Wolverine, get ready for some fun in the Danger Room that can't be missed! The hero that makes the best use of their powers and has uncanny reactions to the situation they're in will win.

Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught is a competitive skirmish game in which each player controls an adventuring party from one of the powerful factions of the Forgotten Realms. Parties delve into dungeons, battle rival adventurers, and confront fearsome monsters on a quest for treasure and glory.

In more detail, Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught is a scenario-based combat game in which you collect treasure, level up, and bring powerful abilities to bear using dice rolls, upgrade cards, and the new combat dial card system to keep track of the action.

The core set of Onslaught includes material for two players, including twelve characters from two factions (Harpers and Zhentarim) and a horde of monsters — 21 pre-painted figures in all.

You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the culprit among yourselves, solve the murder and spend an exciting and fun evening with "Nur der Tod träumt nicht" ("Only Death Doesn't Dream").

Background
Drenched in sweat, you wake up, having been rudely awakened. You are a participant of an experiment about dreams with Prof. Dromen. Last night you went to bed under his care in the sleep laboratory together with other test persons. That same night, Prof. Dromen was murdered in the diagnostic room. Did someone have a score to settle with him? Does the murder have something to do with the experiment? Or is it all just a bad dream? Uncover the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

Dark Files: 01-KOMA is a multimedia detective game experience in a realistic criminal case.

Detectives work together to solve a case with the help of the information provided in different ways: Some information is provided by the printed media within the game (like newspapers, photos, business cards, letters etc.), another part of the information is provided digitally (on websites, by phone calls or SMS). Therefore the following tools are necessary to play the game: mobile phone and internet browser.

What happened to Ben? - You find your friend Ben (39) knocked out and unconscious in his kitchen. After taking the necessary steps to help him, you wonder what could have happened. As a friend and close confidant, you dive into Ben's life and try to find out with your mutual acquaintance Larissa why Ben fell victim to this crime. And what does his current case have to do with it?
A gripping and multidimensional TRUE CRIME detective game experience.

Koma is the 1st case of the dark files detective game series. Each case is self-contained. Dive into the exciting world of detective games. Solve puzzles, crack codes, examine documents, combine evidence and facts, draw conclusions and solve the case!

Market Works is an engaging card game that immerses players in the world of finance and investment through strategic gameplay. Designed for 2-4 players, this game combines the thrill of competition with the intricacies of managing finances, making it a captivating experience for both casual gamers and those with an interest in the financial markets.

In Market Works, players start with a set amount of money and a goal to be the first to accumulate $50,000 without incurring debt, or to be the last one standing after all other players have either gone bankrupt or been unable to manage their debts. The game is played with a deck of cards divided into three main types: Action, Market, and Expense cards, each playing a crucial role in the game's dynamics.

The gameplay revolves around investing money, handling unexpected expenses, and navigating the volatile market to maximize returns. Players can invest their money during their turn, locking it up until a Market card is played, which will determine the return on their investments based on market conditions represented by the Bull and Bear cards. Bull cards double the investments of all players, while Bear cards halve them, adding a layer of risk and strategy to the investment decisions.

Action cards offer players opportunities to directly influence their own financial standing or interfere with their opponents' strategies. These include the Spy card, allowing a player to view another's hand; the Rob card, which lets a player steal a card from an opponent; and the Loan card, providing a quick cash boost at the risk of incurring debt.

Expense cards introduce an element of unpredictability, simulating real-life financial challenges that require players to pay specified sums to the bank. These expenses must be paid with savings, adding a strategic layer to managing invested and uninvested funds.

Market Works is not just a game of chance; it requires strategic thinking, careful planning, and a bit of cunning to navigate the financial challenges and opportunities that arise. With its mix of competitive gameplay, financial strategy, and a dash of luck, Market Works offers high replay value, ensuring that no two games are ever the same. Players will need to adapt their strategies in response to the dynamic market conditions and the actions of their opponents to emerge victorious.

Whether you're looking for a fun way to spend an evening with friends or family or you're a budding financier eager to test your investment strategies in a risk-free environment, Market Works promises a compelling and enjoyable experience that will keep you coming back for more.

ãƒ€ã‚¤ã‚¨ãƒƒãƒˆãƒªãƒ† (Dietrick-taking) is a trick-taking game from Japan.

Your fat tummy, upper arms, and thighs have continued to advocate for a diet.
And finally, you decided to listen to their voice (that's so great).
The player who finds the balance between diet and exercise and has the most successful diet will be the winner.

Trick-taking with a card with numbers 1-9 and 4 suits, the winner of trick raises 2 types of the gauges. The lowest player gives each player a hand of cards and replenishes his or her hand from the deck.

The player with the smallest difference between the numbers on the two gauges wins.

—description from the publisher

In this Cults & Covens game. Players take on the roles of Lovecraftian gods competing to grow the most influential cult. Villager cards from the play area can be taken as priests that can take actions and give their god influence over their families or cultists who can be drained for strength. Players must balance their need for initiative with their need for power and their need for influence over the 5 noble families.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Cults is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.

Agents of Adventure is a one-player adventure card game set in a fantastical version of 1920s and 1930s earth.

Players lead a team of three heroes on a thrilling mission, their every move hindered by an evil mastermind and their dastardly minions.

Every round, your heroes roll a number of dice equal to their dice stat. Each dice can be spent to perform an action like attacking, resting, furthering your objective or performing one of the special actions on a hero card. The value of the dice represents the speed and power of the action. Low rolls can be spent on fast, weak actions. Higher rolls can be spent on slower, more powerful actions.

The game is won when all the objectives on the mission card have been completed. The game is lost when all three heroes are incapacitated or you run out of time.

—description from the designer

Created with the spirit of arcade gaming : you put a coin inside the machine, push the start button, play 5 minutes, lose, put another coin, play 5 minutes, lose again, you don't have coins anymore, you leave, it's fun. Play a hand-drawn rally game from behind the wheel with a top notch view !

With a simple accelerate/decelerate mecanism thanks to 3 dices, an ABS system which gives you a dice bonus, a damage system and up to 3 unique vehicles and 6 stages to choose from, this game is a good filler which can take a short time to play thanks to multiple modes like "Quick race" or "Championship".

Participated in the 2021 7th Roll & Write Contest on BGG as the first board game of Kikwik.

Grab your suitcase and lets explore Europe!

Borders: Europe is the game about discovering the countries of Europe and how they fit together.

As an owner of a set of Borders cards you and your family can play many different games. The main "Make the Map" game, players use the connections between countries to play out cards from their hand whilst building a map of Europe.

There are other games which kids can play solitaire or in groups, there are rules to balance games between different ages and skill levels, there are co-operative games and competitive games.

Through all the different game modes, players incidentally learn about the flags and countries of Europe, their connections, their capital cities and more.

Gears of Industry is a Personalized Card Game (PCG) for 2-4 players. All players build their personalized decks from the same fixed card pool of two Tech Decks (52-cards). Each player customizes their own 26-card play deck to create a unique play experience to reflect their personality and play-style. Players also bring a customized 15-card Market deck contribution. Players combine their personalized Market deck contributions into a single communal Market deck. The theme of the game is an economic factory engine building game during the modern post-industrial era

Players play card(s) into markets. When the active player has three cards in a market that player can trigger a market clash (poker hand competition). They compete against other players by making poker hands to score points. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. The first to get to 7 victory points wins the game. Ties are broken with the value of a player’s factory and market cards.

GAME PLAY – Each player's personalized play deck will contain Technology cards (Gear cards) which represent factories. Factory cards allow other cards to be played into the two Markets. Horizontal (left or right-facing) Factory cards pay for playing Market cards. Upright and upside-down Factory cards can boost a market. Each market contains two neutral market cards. On their turn, the active player can use game effects on their Market cards or one of the neutral Market cards. The active player can trigger a Market Clash. During a Market Clash all the players compete in a Market by making the best poker hand they can using the player’s market cards, the two neutral market cards, and one factory card in the market boost orientation. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. Winning players score 1 victory point for a poker hand up to a three of a kind, or 2 points for higher ranked hands. Factory cards are rotated when Market cards are played and during the Market Clash step.

Dragonborne is a solitaire fantasy wargame played with a narrative campaign. The player assumes the role of the titular Dragonborne: a person who is psychically bonded to an ancient biological war machine known as a Dragon. Together, the Dragon and rider confront a series of enemies human, mechanical and monstrous in tactical battles of resource and position management on their journey to fulfil their destiny.

This is a pure solitaire game. All enemy activity is regulated by an automata controlled by a single die roll per turn and answering a few questions. There are 29 different opponents included, each presenting their own strengths and weaknesses for the player to discover and overcome. Each battle is connected to the next by a story, and the player's resources are persistent from one fight to the next so thinking ahead is critical. Depending on the player's performance, they will end up playing one of three branching campaign paths, each with their own different opponents.

As the story progresses, the Dragon will evolve, gaining new powers and abilities randomly or as directed by the player along an evolutionary tree. There are 60 different evolutionary powers to choose from and combine, allowing for a huge range of strategies. You may end up with a massive, heavily-armoured Dragon able to absorb incoming attacks and retaliate using the attacker's own energy, a swift, nimble Dragon that outmaneuvers it's opponents before finishing them with precision attacks, an offensive powerhouse that rends it's enemies to pieces with jaw and tail, or a shamanistic monster that uses magic and the elements to overcome adversaries.

Beast Clans is a collectible trading card battle game, set in a post-apocalyptic world ruled by beasts.

Humans have vanished from Earth without a trace leaving only the animals to take their place. Over many years, they evolved becoming creatures able to fight. They created their own world of eight kingdoms: Ocean, Marsh, Jungle, Desert, Mountain, Savannah, Arctic, Outback and the Rebels.

Arcs is a sharp, tactical space opera game set in a dark yet silly universe. Players represent officials from a distant, decaying and neglectful Empire who are now free to vie for dominance whether through battle, gathering scarce resources or diplomatic intrigue. Ready yourself for dramatic twists and turns as you launch into this galactic struggle.

A deck of cards in 4 suits with ranks from 1-7 (2-6 for fewer than 4 players) defines the action selection system. These cards are played in a trick-taking adjacent system to select actions, take the initiative and declare Ambitions. The 3 declared Ambitions are what will score in that deal. Timing is everything. Bad hands must be mitigated by careful card play and benefitting from other players' card play.

Battles are resolved quickly with the attacker choosing their level of risk. The defenders must be prepared with adequate defensive ships and cards in their tableau.

Each game contains a hundred wooden ships and agents, 18 custom engraved dice, a beautiful six-panel board, and tons of cards with over 60 pieces of unique art. The base game may be played without the optional Leaders and Lore cards (for an easier teach) or with them for a richer, fuller and asymmetric game. It is also the core of the campaign game (requiring the Blighted Reach Expansion), which provides an epic, more thematic experience.

The shadows deepen around your campsite in the first watch of the night. An enemy appears. Rouse your companions!

In the First Watch box, you’ll find 85 verse cards suited by the Fruit of the Spirit. These are divided into a 50-card Lightraider deck and a 35-card Battle deck. You’ll also find rule cards plus a key card to help you use this deck with other Lightraiders games. The Battle deck includes the cards you need to score victories. These are verses used when battling allegorical enemies in the Lightraiders realm.

If you don’t remember the verse referenced on the battle card in play, use a lightraider card from your hand that matches its suit. Or recite a verse from a card in an opponent’s hand. Of course, you can only see the reference on the back of your opponent’s card, so you’ll have to rely on memory.

Lightraiders play this game on the road and at Lightraider Academy to practice sacred verses and prepare for battle. Now you can play First Watch at home. Even better, use your First Watch cards for organization and reference during other lightraider adventures. This set makes a great companion to the original DragonRaid Vintage Boxed Set or Starlots the Game. Game effects are listed on each card, and each card also incorporates a real-life Scripture application to expand your discipleship learning.

Intended as Bible memory verse tool that has been gamified to support an expanded/enhanced play method for DragonRaid and/or Starlots.

Microbes is a simple family game that entertains both the youngest and the parents. The goal: to stay sick by guarding against large microbes or by catching those of others.

Players receive a microbe card (value 1-10) and three more are placed in front of the card shuffler (brewer). Starting with the player to the left of the brewer, the latter will secretly look at his card and may be able to keep it, or exchange with the next player. The exchange is automatically accepted, unless the player under a Atchoum! of value 10, which means that the exchange is refused and that both players must keep their original card. When the turn of the brewer comes, he can keep his card, or else, having no one left with whom to trade, replace it with one of the three in front of him.

When the round ends, the player(s) with the lowest value card loses the round and a box of tissues.

Microbes est un jeu familial simple qui amuse tant les plus jeunes que les parents.
Le but : rester malade en garde pour soi les gros microbes ou en attrapant ceux des autres.
Deroulement: Après avoir pris leurs jetons boîtes de mouchoirs, chaque joueur reçoit une carte microbe (d'une valeur de 1 à 10) et trois autres sont placés devant le brasseur de cartes. En commançant par le joueur à gauche du brasseur, celui-ci regardera secrètement sa carte et pourra être la conserver, soit l'échange avec le joueur suivant. L'échange est automatiquement accepté, sauf si le joueur sous une carte microbe Atchoum ! de valeur 10, ce qui fait en sorte que l'échange est refusé et que les deux joueurs doivent conserver leur carte d'origine. Quand vient le tour du brasseur, il peut être conservé sa carte, ou bien, n'ayant plus personne avec qui fait d'échange, la remplacer par l'une des trois qui se trouvent devant lui. Lorsque le tour se termine, le ou les joueur(s) avec la carte de la plus faible valeur perd la manche et une boîte de mouchoirs.

The Burger Bear Bonanza! Game from Mudpuppy is a fun new game to see who can really stack up!

Players can match, stack & steal toppings to build burger bears! Whoever completes 2 burger bears wins and is the bear to beat!

Think you can guess how many floors are in the Empire State Building?

In Shoot for the Stars, you don’t need to know the exact answer to win coins. You just need to shout out a number that gets close... without going over.

Whenever someone gives an answer, you have to decide whether you’ll guess higher, stick along for the ride or abandon ship. Guess too high and you win nothing, but make the right call and you’ll blast off with all the coins.

Three great movie games in one big VHS. Each one is like a round of Movie Charades mixed with Family Fortunes.

Lord of the Rings. Back to the Future. The Godfather. There’s been some great trilogies over the years — but this one’s a real show-stopper.

Introducing the Blockbuster Box Set. Three dynamite party games about the movies you know and love, all wrapped up in one giant VHS bundle. Play them one at a time or combine all three games together for a big-budget, Blockbuster-style showdown. All you’ll need to bring are the players... and a decent amount of popcorn.

Yea o Nay is a simple but very competitive game.

90 cards divided into 5 categories of math questions/ IQ statements/ patterns observations/ quantities and colours.  
Each card features a simple conundrum and each player have to be the first to guess/ estimate/ work out or remember if the card on the table is true or not ie yea o Nay. 
If the answer is yea – be the first to put down a green card and a red card if the answer is  Nay. 
Now with a new card on the table, the process repeats and so on.

Whoever is the first to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

å¦–ç²¾ã®æ–½ã— (Fairy's Alms) (ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¢ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚ºã‚¢ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚¹) is a co-operative game from Japan. Players are working together to get the two characters RÅ« (ãƒ«ãƒ¼) and KÅ« (ã‚¯ãƒ¼) (a cat-girl and a rabbit-girl). The two friends are 'dream world dwellers', and the aim is to make all their dreams come true together with them.

Each player gets a character to help the friends, and some numbered cards they keep secret. The player lays their cards face-down in front of them, from lowest to highest, with the negative numbers to the left, and the positive to the right of their character. In tis way, players give an idea to each other what cards they might hold.

The dream world is a set of Dream cards laid out face-down in the middle of the table. The cards are staggered from one to four and back to one. The players must guide the two friends RÅ« and KÅ« on a path through these dreams, but they only win if they can complete all seven steps.

Each time a Dream card is turned up, the players decide which number card they will contribute. They have to combine their cards to add exactly to the one of the numbers on the Dream card. So if the Dream card has a number 1, players can use a +5, -3, -4 and +3 to get a total of 1. Players can discuss what they might offer, but not the exact values of their cards.

If the players fail to satisfy one Dream card, the game is lost.
user summary

The Pit is a semi-cooperative dungeon/arena-crawler from 1 to 4 players with a duration of 8 rounds. In The Pit players act as legend who aims to obtain the absolute power contained in the depths of The Pit. In The Pit, you will not only have to fight for victory, but you will also have to work with your enemy to be able to destroy the seal of the Pit and defeat its guardian before the universe collapses and everything is swallowed in the nothingness. However, only ONE will be the winner... or NONE!

The game is divided into 2 phases:

     The 1st phase: Through 4 rounds characters explore The Pit, which is filled randomly with events. In this phase, the characters will have to accumulate as much power as possible to enhance their abilities. 
     The 2nd phase: During the next 4 rounds The Pit seal is activated by summoning an ancient Nemesis (Boss) into the battlefield. Characters must defeat it before the end of this phase, or the universe will collapse and the power of The Pit destroy everything.


To win, players must defeat the BOSS before the end of the 8th round,  then the victory points are counted. The player with the most  wins the game.

Otherwise, The game ends with the defeat of both players if the BOSS is  still alive at the end of the 8th round.

The Pit also offers a fully cooperative game mode, a solo mode, a boss rush mode and a sudden death mode more oriented towards PvP.

The Pit is calling!

—description from the designer
